Examples

ClientAccumulator.cpp

00001 
00009 #include "ClientAccumulator.h"
00010 
00011 using namespace std;
00012 
00013 using namespace Omiscid;
00014 
00015 namespace Omiscid {
00016 
00022 class ClientConnectorAndVariableListener : public ConnectorListener, public RemoteVariableChangeListener
00023 {
00024 public:
00025     /* @brief constructor */
00026     ClientConnectorAndVariableListener()
00027     {
00028     }
00029 
00030     /* @brief destructor */
00031     virtual ~ClientConnectorAndVariableListener()
00032     {
00033     }
00034 
00035     /* @brief callback function overide to receive data */
00036     void MessageReceived(Service& TheService, const SimpleString LocalConnectorName, const Message& Msg)
00037     {
00038         // Create a SimpleString with message and output it
00039         // even if we can directly output it. Show usage of SimpleString
00040 
00041         SimpleString Message = Msg.GetBuffer();
00042 
00043         cerr << Message << endl;
00044     }
00045 
00046     /* @ brief callback for variable changes notification */
00047     void VariableChanged(ServiceProxy& SP, const SimpleString VarName, const SimpleString NewValue )
00048     {
00049         // cout << "Current Accu value: " << NewValue << endl;
00050     };
00051 };
00052 
00053 } // namespace Omiscid
00054 
00055 #ifdef OMISCID_RUNING_TEST
00056 // Call test in a separate function
00057 int DoClientAccumulator( int argc, char*argv[] )
00058 #else
00059 /* @brief main program entry for the Accumulator. No need to give parameter */
00060 int main( int argc, char*argv[] )
00061 #endif // OMISCID_RUNING_TEST
00062 {
00063     // Instanciate a Connector and a Variable listener (must *not* be destroyed before it has
00064     // been removed for the connector or until the service is destroyed).
00065     ClientConnectorAndVariableListener MyListener;
00066 
00067     // Ask to the service factory to create a Service. The service is not
00068     // register yet. We do not provide the service class, the default value 'Service'
00069     // will be used
00070     Service * pAccuClient = ServiceFactory.Create( "Accumulator Client" );
00071 
00072     // If something tricky occurred, exit
00073     if ( pAccuClient == NULL )
00074     {
00075         fprintf( stderr, "Could not create the Accumulator Client service.\n" );
00076 
00077         // Exit the thread
00078         return -1;
00079     }
00080 
00081     // Add a Connector to send commands and receive error messages (AnInOutput) and set my callback
00082     // object to receive notification of messages
00083     pAccuClient->AddConnector( "SendCommands", "A way to send commands to the Accumulator", AnInOutput );
00084     pAccuClient->AddConnectorListener( "SendCommands", &MyListener );
00085 
00086     // Trace
00087     printf( "Accumulator Client created.\n" );
00088 
00089     // A proxy to communicate with the Accumulator
00090     ServiceProxy * OneAccumulator = NULL;
00091 
00092     // Loop for searching an Accumulator
00093     printf( "Search for an Accumulator service.\n" );
00094     for( int NbTry = 1; NbTry <= 5; NbTry ++ )
00095     {
00096         // Search for services, wait 5 s (5000 ms) to get an answer
00097         // Get in return a ServiceProxy*. This service is nammed Accumalator, gets a variable
00098         // Accu and an InOutput connector "Commands"
00099         ServiceFilter * MySearch = And(NameIs("Accumulator"),HasVariable("Accu"), HasConnector("Commands",AnInOutput) );
00100 
00101         OneAccumulator = pAccuClient->FindService( MySearch, 5000 );
00102 
00103         // empty and them delete Search filter
00104         MySearch->Empty();
00105         delete MySearch;
00106 
00107         if ( OneAccumulator == (ServiceProxy*)NULL )
00108         {
00109             fprintf( stderr, "Search for an Accumulator service failed. Try again...\n" );
00110             continue;
00111         }
00112 
00113         break;
00114     }
00115 
00116     if ( OneAccumulator == (ServiceProxy*)NULL )
00117     {
00118         fprintf( stderr, "Could not find an Accumulator service. quit !\n" );
00119 
00120         // delete
00121         delete pAccuClient;
00122         return -1;
00123     }
00124 
00125     // register the Client service and launch everything
00126     // we must do it before communicating with the Accumalator
00127     pAccuClient->Start();
00128 
00129     // Connect to the Accumulator
00130     if ( pAccuClient->ConnectTo( "SendCommands", OneAccumulator, "Commands" ) == true )
00131     {
00132         // Subscribe to variables changes for Accu. We will receive a first callback
00133         // when done
00134         OneAccumulator->AddRemoteVariableChangeListener( "Accu", &MyListener );
00135 
00136         // Enter command prompt, 1er time with help
00137         cout << "Enter new command ('+4', '/5.5', ' *8.59', '-6', ' = 8.2'...): " << endl;
00138 
00139         // Do my work
00140         SimpleString LocalCommand;
00141 #ifdef OMISCID_RUNING_TEST
00142         // Do it automatically, first compute EllapseTime, test must take almost 30 seconds
00143         ElapsedTime TotalRunTime;
00144 
00145         do
00146         {
00147             // choose randomly operation
00148             int Operation = random() % 4;
00149             switch( Operation )
00150             {
00151                 case 1:
00152                     LocalCommand = "+";
00153                     break;
00154                 case 2:
00155                     LocalCommand = "-";
00156                     break;
00157                 case 3:
00158                     LocalCommand = "*";
00159                     break;
00160                 default:
00161                     LocalCommand = "/";
00162                     break;
00163             }
00164 
00165             // Choose a common value (range 1 to 10);
00166             int Value = 1 + (random() % 10);
00167             LocalCommand += Value;
00168 
00169             pAccuClient->SendToAllClients( "SendCommands", LocalCommand, false );
00170 
00171             // Go to sleep for 50 ms
00172             Sleep( 50 );
00173         }
00174         while( TotalRunTime.Get() < 30*1000 /* 30 seconds */ );
00175 
00176         fprintf( stderr, "AccumulatorClient stops.\n" );
00177 #else
00178         // run it interactively
00179         for(;;)
00180         {
00181             // Get the local command at keyboard
00182             cin >> LocalCommand;
00183 
00184             // Send to all connected Client... Here we are connected to only one accumulator
00185             // we can also use SentToOneClient...
00186             pAccuClient->SendToAllClients( "SendCommands", (char*)LocalCommand.GetStr(), LocalCommand.GetLength(), false );
00187         }
00188 #endif
00189     }
00190     else
00191     {
00192         fprintf( stderr, "Could not connect to the Accumulator connector. quit !\n" );
00193     }
00194 
00195     // cleanup everything
00196     delete pAccuClient;
00197     delete OneAccumulator;
00198 
00199     // exit
00200     return 0;
00201 }
